response:
Urgent MRI is needed to confirm cerebellar and optic nerve lesions and exclude compressive posterior fossa pathology. CSF and evoked potentials help demonstrate dissemination in space/time for MS and distinguish demyelinating from other inflammatory or infectious causes. Blood tests look for inflammatory, nutritional, metabolic, autoimmune and infectious mimics, while specialised ophthalmic tests characterise the optic neuropathy and quantify baseline function.
